timeline.author: AlanConfluent

timeline.bodyText: Do we want the url safe version?  Not sure if we have a precedent elsewhere in the codebase.
timeline.author: AlanConfluent

replies.bodyText:
There's a Base64 that's url safe, meaning it swaps a few characters to that it doesn't use any URL special characters.  https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-codec/apidocs/org/apache/commons/codec/binary/Base64.html#encodeBase64URLSafe-byte:A-
I think it's fine not to do that.  This is the standard version.
replies.author: AlanConfluent

timeline.bodyText:
https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/lang/String.html#String(byte[],%20java.nio.charset.Charset)
Says that it will replace unmappable chars to the default character for the charset.  This might be fine, but just wanted to point out we could throw an error.
I tend to think programmer mistakes should be errors, whereas row by row data mistakes should be more forgiving, so maybe what you have is the right thing, but just wanted to point it out.
timeline.author: AlanConfluent

replies.bodyText: Yes, that was my thinking as well
replies.author: vpapavas

timeline.author: AlanConfluent

timeline.bodyText: Isn't the input here not ascii?  I guess these get replaces with the default character and that's what's getting encoded?

timeline.bodyText: This is public mutable state.   Better to make it immutable, i.e. use ImmutableMap.builder().
